üíº‚ÄØPublic Servant | Visionary Leader | Advocate for Good Governance

text:
YOU FAILED THE PEOPLE, NOW HIDING BEHIND ZONING, MOGHALU FIRES BACK AT SOLUDO

The George Moghalu Campaign Organization has taken note of Governor Charles Soludo‚Äôs recent comments on zoning in relation to the 2025 governorship election. While every citizen has the right to participate in the democratic process, we owe it to ourselves and to Ndi Anambra to speak the truth plainly.

Let us recall that Governor Soludo contested the governorship in 2003 under the PDP, and again in 2013 under APGA. On neither occasion did he show regard for any zoning agreement. Zoning was never part of his political vocabulary when it did not serve his interest. But now that the tide has turned, he suddenly clings to it for political survival. Ndi Anambra are watching and they are wiser now.

However, we must remind our people that zoning is to Anambra South, not to Soludo. It is a call for equity and balance, not a personal entitlement. Anambra South still has four more years to provide leadership for the state, and it must be based on competence, capacity, and performance, not recycled promises and political self-preservation.

We must also remember that the Constitution provides every elected governor with a four-year mandate. A second term is not an entitlement. It must be earned. It must be justified with visible achievements, not empty slogans.

Has Governor Soludo delivered on the bold promises he made? Where is the African Dubai-Taiwan he proudly proclaimed? What tangible improvements can the people see? Are there new schools, hospitals, roads, or infrastructure projects to point to? Is Anambra more secure today than it was yesterday?

Across the state, our traders are burdened by suffocating and excessive taxation. Many face daily harassment from government agents, especially the infamous ndi Aka ·ªåd·ªç, whose intimidation tactics have created an atmosphere of fear and frustration. The realities on the streets sharply contradict the narratives from government press briefings.

In contrast, Dr. George Moghalu is not coming to sell dreams. He offers Ndi Anambra a tested and trusted alternative. A proud son of Nnewi North in Anambra South, he believes in equity and has already pledged to serve a single term. To him, governance is a relay. If a serious leader cannot deliver in four years, they cannot deliver in eight.

It is time for Ndi Anambra to stand firm and insist that eight years is not an entitlement. It is not automatic. It is a privilege reserved only for governors who deliver on their promises, who perform, and who earn the people‚Äôs trust through results, not propaganda. Governance is not about occupying office. It is about impact. If you have not delivered in four years, you do not deserve four more.

Dr. Moghalu comes prepared with a master plan that will fundamentally transform governance in Anambra. His vision is clear, practical, and people-driven, not built on soundbites or borrowed metaphors. He offers leadership that delivers, not leadership that distracts.

The Labour Party has the answer to the challenges facing Anambra. Our national leader, His Excellency Peter Obi, and His Excellency Alex Otti, the performing governor of Abia State, have already set the pace. Their results speak for themselves. Dr. George Moghalu is ready to replicate that standard of responsible, people-first governance here in Anambra.

Ndi Anambra are awake. They have grown tired of sweet talk and deception. They will not be swayed by high-sounding grammar, abstract theories, or recycled slogans like ‚Äúnke a b·ª• nke any·ªã.‚Äù

This election is not about oratory. It is about results. Ndi Anambra will judge by performance, by integrity, and by vision. And come 2025, they will choose progress, not excuses.

text:
MOGHALU HOSTS URUAGU NNEWI YOUTHS, REAFFIRMS COMMITMENT TO GRASSROOTS DEVELOPMENT

The Labour Party governorship candidate in Anambra State, Dr. George Moghalu, on Friday hosted the youths of Uruagu Nnewi at the Obi of Uruagu Palace, where he reaffirmed his commitment to youth empowerment, grassroots development, and inclusive governance.

The meeting, which witnessed a large turnout of enthusiastic youths, was held in an atmosphere of open dialogue and mutual respect. It provided a platform for sincere engagement on the future of Anambra, with the youths expressing both pride and hope.

In his address, Dr. Moghalu stated that his ambition to lead Anambra is driven not by personal interest, but by a shared desire to build a better state anchored on transparency, opportunity, and equity. He assured the youths that their welfare remains a core part of his agenda.

‚ÄúThis is not a personal mission it is a collective movement to return governance to the people,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúYouths will play a central role in my administration through job creation, skills development, educational reform, improved security, and infrastructure renewal.‚Äù

He further highlighted the role of his foundation in equipping young people across the state with vocational training and tools to become self-reliant, adding that his commitment to youth-led initiatives is longstanding and unwavering.

‚ÄúI am not far from you‚ÄîI am one of you,‚Äù Moghalu said. ‚ÄúI will continue to stand with you, support your efforts, and walk with you in building stronger communities.‚Äù

The President General of Uruagu Nnewi Youths, Mr. Ejike Ifejiofor, lauded Dr. Moghalu for his consistent support and his accessibility over the years. He expressed the community‚Äôs satisfaction that a son of Nnewi is at the forefront of the governorship race.

‚ÄúWe are proud that  Nnewi son is a frontline candidate in this election,‚Äù Mr. Ifejiofor said. ‚ÄúYou have always stood by us, and today, we are standing with you 100 percent. This is our own,‚Äù the youths said.

The event ended on a high note, with the youths pledging their unflinching support for Moghalu‚Äôs vision and leadership, expressing renewed hope for a united and progressive Anambra.

‚ÄúAnambra ga-adi mma ozo,‚Äù Dr. Moghalu declared, echoing a shared belief in a brighter tomorrow under purposeful and people-centered leadership.

text:
Today, I had the honour of attending the maiden International Conference at the University Auditorium, themed ‚ÄúAfrica at the Crossroads: Confronting Governance, Security, and Development Challenges in the 21st Century.‚Äù

It was a moment of deep reflection and a powerful call to action, a reminder that reclaiming Africa‚Äôs future requires courage, honesty and collective responsibility.

My sincere appreciation goes to the Acting Vice Chancellor of Nnamdi Azikiwe University Awka, Prof. Carol Arinze Umeobi, and the Department of Political Science for leading this timely conversation.

As we look to the future of Africa, we must also reflect on the role of states like Anambra, blessed with human capital, resilience and potential. If we get it right here, we can inspire the rest of the continent.

That is why I am committed to building a safer, more prosperous Anambra, where infrastructure works, schools and hospitals function, and every citizen has a fair shot at a better life. We will restore trust in governance and ensure that the dividends of democracy reach every community.

Let us rise to the challenge with clarity of purpose, unity of spirit and unwavering belief that Africa‚Äôs best days are still ahead.

Together, we must build the Africa and Anambra we deserve.
Anambra ga adi mma ozo.

.....GNM

text:
Yesterday, I visited the St. Martins Community Children and Welfare Home project in Ezinifite, Aguata, and I was deeply moved. What I saw reaffirmed my belief that governance must have a human face. This project, under the Catholic Diocese of Ekwulobia led by His Eminence, Cardinal Peter Ebere Okpaleke, is a lifeline for orphans, abandoned children, the mentally challenged, and neglected adults in our society.

The mission behind St. Martins speaks directly to my heart and aligns with my vision for Anambra. The welfare of the vulnerable has always been a passion of mine.

I remember a woman I once visited who was living in conditions that no human being should endure. By the grace of God, we built and furnished a two-room apartment for her. That experience changed me. It taught me that compassion must be the soul of leadership.

That is why I‚Äôm throwing my full support behind this project. I‚Äôve made a financial contribution, yes, but more importantly, I‚Äôve committed to walking this journey with them. I will stand by this mission until it is completed.

When elected, projects like St. Martins will not be sidelined. They will be embraced, supported, and scaled. No part of Anambra will be left behind. We will build a government that uplifts those who need help the most.

I sincerely thank His Eminence, Cardinal Okpaleke, for the warm reception and his continued prayers. To the Ezinifite community, I am with you. Together, we will bring this vision to life.

text:
@ChibuikeNnechi My brother Chibuike, I want you to know that Omambala is not just a region to me; it is home. And Ayamelum, as a critical part of that region, is not forgotten. Your concern is valid and I appreciate you voicing it.

Let me be clear: I am not coming to seek your votes with empty promises or vague platitudes. What I am offering Ndi Ayamelum is a pact a covenant of accountability.

I know the story. You‚Äôve been promised roads that vanished with the rains. You‚Äôve been assured of agricultural transformation while your farmers still wade through muddy, impassable tracks. The development you see today was rooted in the genuine effort of H.E. Peter Obi and that should not stop there.

I‚Äôm not just a candidate; I‚Äôm a man of my word. I‚Äôve served the nation at high levels, and my record speaks of consistency, accessibility, and results. My commitment is simple: Ayamelum will not be abandoned.

As governor, I will invest in your roads, support your farmers with access to markets, and build the infrastructure that reflects the strength of your contribution to Anambra‚Äôs economy. I will personally maintain a direct channel with Ayamelum stakeholders traditional leaders, youth groups, women, and farmers to ensure no decision affecting you is made without your voice.

I‚Äôm not coming to rule. I‚Äôm coming to serve. And I‚Äôm ready to be held accountable by Ndi Ayamelum and all of Anambra.

text:
ANAMBRA GUBER: MOGHALU TO ELEVATE OMAMBALA INTO FOOD BASKET OF THE STATE

Reassures he will serve only one tenure

Ahead of the 2025 governorship election in Anambra State, the candidate of the Labour Party for the election Dr George Moghalu (Ohamadike Nnewi) has promised to pull government force to develop agriculture on a massive note in Omambala axis of the State if elected. Omambala is a large clan made up of six Local Government Areas which include Anambra East and West, Oyi, Ayamelum, Awka North and Dunukofia.

Moghalu who made the promise while addressing the Omambala Stakeholders during a town hall meeting at Umeri told the audience made up of eminent personalities including top ranking traditional rulers, elder statesmen, captains of industries, the clergy and the political class that he knows about the potential of Omambala clan in agriculture and will ensure that the potential will be fully unleashed for the benefit of the State if he emerges the Governor of Anambra State.

According to him "there is no sentiment about it, Omambala has the potential to feed Anambra State as the food basket of the State. And I want to assure you that I will elevate Omambala to take up the noble role as the food basket of the State. I will provide security and ensure that farmers are provided with all the necessary materials to enable them engage in mechanised farming to cultivate and process food at the commercial level whereby people can go to Eke Awka or Nkwo Nnewi and buy food stuff produced in Omambala villages.

Going further on security, the Labour Party candidate assured the audience that he will put an end to security challenges like kilings and kidnapping by applying modern security gadgets as obtainable in Enugu like vehicle with radio communication, walkie talkies, wider range of CCTV camera and adequate remuneration of vigilante operatives adding that he will make security job attractive to University graduates.

In summary, the Ohamadike Nnewi who also assured that he will enhance quality education, health care services and boost road infrastructure across the Omambala axis, told the audience that he is going to restore people's confidence in government by being accessible, transparent and accountable in discharging his duties. Most importantly, he vowed to serve for only one tenure to pave the way for the smooth maintenance of zoning and rotation of power in Anambra State.

In response, the speakers after speaker appreciated the Labour Party candidate for his passion for the well-being of Anambra State he has the qualities needed to move the State. Opening the flood of response the President of the Omambala Union and elder statesman Dr Chike Obidigbo told the visitor that the Omambala is at home with his plan for Anambra State most importantly his decision to serve for only one tenure to pave the way for zoning and rotation of power to remain on board in the State.

The elder statesman who is also the President of Osisioma Foundation added "George, you are my friend and I know you very well. Because you recognize zoning, we will make sure that zoning remains on board so that after the next governor from South competes eight years for South, it will come to Central and subsequently to the North again."

Other Speakers such as the former Chief Judge of Anambra State, Rtd Justice Obidigwe, zonal Chairman of Anambra North Council of Traditional rulers HRM Igwe Dr Benjamin Okeji and the traditional ruler of Umeri HRM Igwe Ben Emeka in one tone noted that God is the maker of Kings advising the Labour Party candidate to keep moving around to sell his ideas and plans with prayer believing that he will emerge as governor if he is the choice of God.

profile_bio.description:
üèõÔ∏è‚ÄØLabour Party Governorship Candidate ‚Äî Anambra State
üíº‚ÄØPublic Servant | Visionary Leader | Advocate for Good Governance

text:
Over the weekend, I had the honour of meeting with the Omambala Union in Umueri, Anambra North ‚Äî a vibrant region made up of six agriculturally rich local government areas. This engagement is part of my continuous consultation with stakeholders across Anambra as we prepare for a new era of governance built on trust, partnership, and results.

Our meeting was chaired by a respected elder and industrialist, Dr. Chike Obidigbo, who reminded us all of Omambala‚Äôs potential as a key driver of agricultural and economic growth in the state. I share that vision deeply.

I came not just to declare my candidacy, but to reaffirm my connection with you. I hold a chieftaincy title from Omasi, and I see this land not as a campaign stop but as home. I am not running alone. I am running with you.

And I have made a commitment that stands: I will serve only one term as governor. I believe that if we are focused, four years is enough to lay a solid foundation, deliver tangible impact, and reset the tone of governance in Anambra. Anything you can‚Äôt do in four years, you won‚Äôt do in eight. I want to serve ‚Äî not sit.

Good governance must be transparent and accessible. I have never turned anyone away from my office to go and ‚Äúfill form.‚Äù That is bureaucracy, not leadership. Service means listening, responding, and standing with the people.

Omambala and the entire Anambra North must be at the table, not on the menu. Agriculture is central to my plan for this state, and this region will be a cornerstone of that plan. We will invest in agro-processing, rural infrastructure, and market access to turn potential into prosperity.

On security, I propose we build a professional, tech-enabled community policing model. Let‚Äôs train our youths. Equip them. Pay them. Give them the dignity of service and the skills to defend our communities. It works in other states ‚Äî it can work here.

Education is another priority. Within my first month in office, I will begin the establishment of digital learning centres across all senatorial zones. We will also strengthen vocational and technical education to prepare our young people for the future.

I‚Äôm not one to make noise, but results speak. Under my leadership at the National Inland Waterways Authority, we recorded milestones including the first cargo vessel to berth at the Onitsha Port in decades. That is the kind of quiet, focused delivery I will bring to Anambra.

This journey is not about me. It‚Äôs about us. It‚Äôs about giving Anambra a government that listens, includes, and delivers. With your support, we will restore confidence, drive real development, and ensure that Omambala and all parts of our dear state get the attention and investment they deserve.

Anambra ga-adi mma.

.....GNM

üèõÔ∏è‚ÄØLabour Party Governorship Candidate ‚Äî Anambra State
üíº‚ÄØPublic Servant | Visionary Leader | Advocate for Good Governance

text:
As my father would say, "oji ji agba ututu ji ga agwu mana ututu a man gwu," which translates to "yam eaten for breakfast will finish, but the morning remains." This proverb encapsulates the essence of delayed gratification and the enduring nature of systemic choices over fleeting individual benefits.

Democracy's unique charm lies in the prompt consequences of electing unsuitable leaders, where the impact is keenly and swiftly felt by the very electorate responsible for the decision. This immediate feedback mechanism ensures a rapid and direct alignment between choice and outcome, embodying a form of political karma that acts without delay.

The act of exchanging one's vote for short-term gain, symbolized by the metaphor of selling a vote for a bag of rice, underscores a critical trade-off. This decision highlights the contrast between immediate, transient satisfaction and the long-term implications for governance and societal well-being.

Vote for credible governance. The time is now. 

#LP
#LabourParty
#anambra2025

profile_bio.description:
üèõÔ∏è‚ÄØLabour Party Governorship Candidate ‚Äî Anambra State
üíº‚ÄØPublic Servant | Visionary Leader | Advocate for Good Governance

text:
It is with profound sorrow that I extend my deepest condolences to the family and loved ones of General Muhammadu Buhari on his passing.

My relationship with him was both personal and professional, forged in our shared journey toward accountability and national renewal during our time in opposition under the All Nigeria Peoples Party (ANPP). President Buhari was a man of deep conviction, firm in his principles and steadfast in his vision for a better Nigeria, even when the tides of reality made that vision difficult to achieve.

In a time when history is often met with judgment‚Äîsome of it justified‚Äîwe must not forget that President Buhari embodied the enduring possibility of democratic change through peaceful, determined opposition. He believed that even entrenched power could be challenged, and ultimately displaced, if the people remained united in purpose and resolute in will. His life is testament to the value of staying the course, and the indispensable role of opposition in a truly functioning democracy.

I remain eternally greatful to him for giving me the opportunity to serve Nigeria, first as Chairman of the Nigerian Communications Satellite Company (NIGCOMSAT) and later as Managing Director of the Nigerian Inland Waterways Authority (NIWA) in which latter role I was able to operstionalise the Onitsha River Port that had been moribund for years. That port operating today and employing people in Anambra State is part of President Buhari's legacy for which I chose to honour his memory and his service. 

May he rest in peace and may  God grant the family he left behind the grace to bear this incomparable loss. Amen

Dr George Moghalu
14th July 2025.

profile_bio.description:
üèõÔ∏è‚ÄØLabour Party Governorship Candidate ‚Äî Anambra State
üíº‚ÄØPublic Servant | Visionary Leader | Advocate for Good Governance

text:
@Austine_Borrest Thank you for bringing up such a critical issue. 
Unfortunately what you have mentioned is not exclusive to Ihiala, but a majority of the LGAs in Anambra. As a business hub that Anambra is, the importance of a functional fire service cannot be over estimated. 

It's indeed disheartening that as a society we are still grappling with such mundane issues. While fire hazards can occurs anywhere, the difference lies in its curtailment and the aftermath. 

That a majority of LGA‚Äôs still lacks a fire service and that Nkwogbe market has suffered so many fire incidents clearly shows a significant gap in our infrastructure and emergency response capabilities, and it's something I'm committed to addressing if elected.

My plan for infrastructural development in Ihiala would include establishing a fully equipped fire service station. This isn't just about buying trucks; it's about creating a comprehensive service with trained personnel, regular drills, and public awareness programs. We'll work with experts to determine the optimal location for the station to ensure quick response times across the LGA. It is not going to be easy because of our lack of awareness and the lack of structure but it is doable. 

For Nkwogbe market, we need a multi-pronged approach. First, we'll conduct a thorough safety audit to identify and fix potential fire hazards, including electrical wiring and storage practices. Then, we'll invest in fire suppression systems, like hydrants and sprinkler systems, and provide fire extinguishers and training to market vendors. Finally, we'll explore options for modernizing the market layout to improve access for emergency vehicles and create firebreaks to prevent fires from spreading. 

With your support, we can transform Ihiala into a safer, more resilient community, ensuring that Nkwogbe market never has to suffer another devastating fire. 

Anambra ga a di wu mma ma anyi nile kwere.

profile_bio.description:
üèõÔ∏è‚ÄØLabour Party Governorship Candidate ‚Äî Anambra State
üíº‚ÄØPublic Servant | Visionary Leader | Advocate for Good Governance

text:
@Austine_Borrest Good afternoon My Brother.

Thank you so much for considering me and for reaching out with such critical questions. 

I understand your concerns deeply, especially because Ihiala, particularly Lilu means so much to me. You may not know this, but Lilu is my maternal home (Iku nne‚Äôm). So when I call you my brother, I mean it in all ramifications. 

The situation there is truly incomprehensible, and I share your desire to be able to visit family without fear. As I've stated in my manifesto, my focus is on security, education, and, crucially, steady electricity.

Addressing the security challenges in Ihiala is my top priority. My plan involves a multi-faceted approach: increased support for local law enforcement, enhanced community policing to build trust, and strategic investments in technology like surveillance to deter crime. We'll also tackle the root causes by creating opportunities for our youth through skills training and jobs.

Regarding the economy, without steady electricity, there can be no meaningful development. My vision is to revitalize Ihiala by attracting new businesses and supporting existing ones, improving infrastructure, streamlining regulations, and promoting Ihiala as a hub for trade and innovation. 

I'm determined to make Anambra work by ensuring we have reliable power. I'm also committed to investing in our local markets and businesses, providing resources and a convenient working environment to help them thrive. 

With your vote and the support of your family and friends, we can restore safety and prosperity to Ihiala, making it a place where you can visit without worry.
